body.name: GSlife Over The Sink Dish Drying Rack Stainless Steel 2 Tier Dish Rack Above Kitchen Sink Shelf Durable Dish Drainer, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 15 hrs 43 mins
features: Save Tons of Space - The over the sink drying rack can help you save tons of space and time by making it easier to access your utensils and supplies. This large-size over the sink dish drainer can hold 32 bowls and 30 plates, and fruits, vegetables, coffee pots, cups, etc

Multi-function Design - With a utensils holder, a cutting board holder, a sponge holder, and metal hooks, this above sink dish rack easily holds utensils, chopsticks, knives, forks, plates, bowls, soap, sponges, cutting boards, and more

Rustproof & Durable - Made of premium 201 stainless steel and processed polishing and welding, this dish drying rack over the sink is durable and rustproof. The anti-slip pads on the bottom of the feet keep the kitchen over sink drying rack safely in place. Bear the weight up to 42 lb

Easy to Assemble - We offer you a detailed instruction manual to easily install over sink dish racks. Creative adjustable rubber feet are adjustable to balance the kitchen over sink rack steady even on the uneven countertop

Fit Most Sinks - Outside dimension:34(L) x 11.4(W) x 32.1(H) inches; Inside dimension: 32.2 (L) x 9.6 (W) x 32.1 (H) inches; the length of sink should be <32 inch, height between the cabinet and countertop should be ≥34 inch, not counting the dishes. NOTE: There is a slight difference because of the manual measurement
body.description: Customer's voice In a small kitchen, this dish rack is a necessity. It saved me so much cabinet space since I could store my dishes on the rack. This dish rack holds so much and is a great space saver. It is so useful and looks great, too. Love it. Sturdy, holds big pots with ease. This item is very sturdy and it fits our space perfectly. I love all the space that it has and it also looks great. We don’t have much counter space so this is perfect for our tiny kitchen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This looks great, holds tons of dishes and a few pots/pans, dries everything over sink and frees up counter space!!! I also added an extra utensil holder, small towel rack and cup and glass holders from my old dishrack and omg 😳 this holds so much and looks great too! Affordable price, its super sturdy and easy to put together (My husband usually does the handy dandy put together stuff). Just follow the directions (not the best) and use their tools and you shouldn’t have any problems. Wish I purchased this years ago- we got so many compliments of this style dishrack.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m don’t have much patience putting stuff together but this was very easy! Even I could do it. Seems very stable. No problems yet. I love it! Only bad thing is that I didn’t have it sooner😜. I have a VERY small kitchen. With the 2 little sinks. So I was worried on finding one that would fit. Bc I also have 2 cabinets above each side of the sink. But it fits just fine. I love how u can expand it or make is smaller for the perfect fit. The water doesn’t drain down all on my counter either. I was worried it would drip behind the it or something. It doesn’t. It frees up so much counter space. I also have a very nosy kitty, who loves to get on my dishes. This helped that as well. I really do recommend this dish drainer! It seems sturdy and perfect for my small family. I’m a single momma with 2 sons and it’s plenty big for us. If u have a large family I’d get one with 3 levels instead of 2. For me, this size is perfect and I couldn’t be happier! Was worth every dollar!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This dish drainer has saved so much counter space. It's sturdy & adjusted to my sink easily. Easy to assemble. I get so many compliments on my kitchen now and it makes washing dishes a pleasure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars She rolling now!
reviews.reviewText: So unfortunately, I bought this without actually measuring my sink and I was just like whatever the hell with it. By the way, bad idea. Nonetheless, I still made it work, what I did was added some castor wheels that I got from Walmart. My daughter and I also added an old top to a storage bin to catch the water. So now, when I wash dishes, I can just roll it over to me. The top to the plastic bin makes it easy to wipe it off, no spill no mess. I will say the only thing that irritated me besides me not actually measuring before I bought, was the bottom bar. If you look closely you can see it’s kind of bent, but again that might actually be my fault for tightening it too tight. Everything else fit in place but that bottom bar. One last thing the stars that they have me grading it on says suction power. No clue what that is for so I’m a put it at a one star. Not trying to bring it down. I guess the grade of it is very good,I just don’t know what is considered suction power if that makes sense.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Learned to love it
reviews.reviewText: This took a min to love. I bought it to be a space saver. At first it was a bit much and I felt like it was obnoxious and an eye soar taking away from the window.Setting looks aside I started using it. And OMG I started to fall in love with it. It holds so much! Then I added some plants to the top which made my heart happy. It really started to grow on me. Now I can’t imagine life without it. I love it in the space and think it adds character.Other reviews mention the knife holder…that piece is completely useless. Horrible design and not functional at all. I have yet to find a use for it. I just put my knives in the utensils holder and that seems to work fine for me. I also forgot to put the hooks on as they need to be done during putting it together and I didn’t realize that. And it wasn’t important enough for me to take it apart to put them on. So just remember to add those when assembling if you want them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Assembly directions must be followed to a T
reviews.reviewText: If you follow the directions as exactly shown on the picture, everything should fit properly together and no swaying whatsoever. I thought the sponge holder I got must have a design flaw because it doesn't stay upright; it turns out I needed to place it on either side of the rack, so it'll sit on top of the bottom, adjacent, horizontal rod of the legs. The first big mistake which caused many of the bad reviews/videos about the shelves not fitting also happened to me until I figured out that the Flat horizontal railing (A1) for the left and right frame should be on the Inside and Not on the Outside, also the same reason for the Swaying. Once this is corrected, everything fits together perfectly and steady. Two things I missed but easily corrected was forgetting to put in the hooks and the rubber cushions for the bottom rod (maybe someone can explain to me why only the bottom rod needs the cushions, but not the other ones?) Yes, the height between the bottom and top shelf is too low for dinner plates, so I just moved that shelf to the top instead. I'm getting non-slip dish drying mat to place under the shelf to catch water that doesn't fall in the sink and to better hold it in place since it's so close to the edges. The utensil holder is just way too small, but my plastic utensil holder from my countertop dish rack fits on it perfectly, so problem solved. Update: My dish washer is on the fritz, so there are a lot more dishes than usual, but makes for a good picture. Again, the utensil holder is too small, so I squeezed the cup size utensil holder into the bottom ring instead of the top ring (slight bending of the top ring is needed to get it to fit between the rings), this made it perfect for holding long handle spatulas and ladles. Instead of having all the hooks on the bottom level, I put 4 of the hooks on the top level; this way they would all be on one side and out of the way of the faucet and washing. The dish drying mat does catch some of the water and also helps to keep the rack from being accidently push out of place, but still have problem with too much water collecting near the back splash. I would move the rack closer forward toward the sink, but the bottom horizontal rod behind the faucet (where the soap dish is hanging) is just a tad too low and would get in the way of the faucet handle. I'm tempted to make my own holes and move that annoying horizontal rod higher up and hang the soap dish on the rod just below the black utensil holder...Overall, it's a very decent over the sink rack for the price. It's my first and definitely helps in giving me more counter space for my very small kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Such a space saver and so convenient!
reviews.reviewText: I thought this was too good to be true at first. I measured to make sure it would fit (luckily the side accessories can be hooked on either side). I assembled, which was easier than I thought it would be, and that was it--my life is changed. 😆 It is so convenient. I gained so much space, everything sits nicely and drains into the sink. I use the books for my dish cloth and dish gloves and when they're dry, you can slide the hooks over to the side. This rack makes me happy to clean and organize! And the plant on top makes it look nice (I was worried it would obscure my window and look junky). 100% recommend. The only thing I can't comment on yet is the cleaning when water buildup starts. I am hoping this will be a breeze, but that remains to be seen. It does come with care instructions so I'll follow what it says.

I have a very small kitchen area with limited counter space as it is, this unit really aided in creating more space plus (Bonus) it helps with keeping the sink area free of clutter.I will add that you're not dealing with mold caused by left over water sitting at the bottom of the rack, this unit is easy to clean (especially the utensil cup). Like most I've dealt with, the old rack I had, you couldn't properly clean the bottom of the utensil holder as it's too small (narrow) to fit your hand in to clean let alone be able to reach the awkward angles with a scrub or brush. I'm able to keep this unit clean without much effort. 👌 definitely a WIN purchase!P.s. easy to build and install 😁

I use this as storage rather than a drying rack. I shy from products that need to be assembled but I was able to put this together with ease. I had to redo one connection…..once. But my skill level is 1 on a scale of 1-10. I am so pleased at the results. Everything is easy to see and reach. My kitchen area looks clean, neat, organized and attractive rather than congested and confusing. Call me happy.
It does the job but should be filly made of aluminum or stainless steel for that price. Other than that is sturdy and holds a lot of my every day dishes keeping the kitchen tidy.
I love this rack we have so much more free space.
